meanings.definition: (ブラジル・ポルトガル語)問題、困難、トラブル、面倒

examples.sentence: Ele sempre se mete em encrencas.

examples.translation: This is going to cause trouble.
examples.english_translation: This is going to cause trouble.

collocations: estar em encrenca (to be in trouble)
meter-se em encrenca (to get into trouble)
sair de uma encrenca (to get out of trouble)

usage_notes.explanation: 「encrenca」はブラジル・ポルトガル語で非常によく使われる単語で、様々な種類の問題や困難を指します。単なる小さな問題から、深刻なトラブルまで、幅広い状況で使用できます。比喩的な意味合いが強く、具体的な問題だけでなく、抽象的な困難や面倒事も表すことができます。

examples.incorrect: Eu tenho uma encrenca com dinheiro.
examples.correct: Eu estou com uma encrenca com dinheiro.
examples.note: 「encrenca」は状態を表すため、動詞「estar」と一緒に使うのが一般的です。
「encrenca」を引き起こす場合は、動詞「arrumar」を使うのがより自然です。

idioms: estar metido em encrencas (to be mixed up in trouble)

readability_explanation.text: 「encrenca」はブラジル・ポルトガル語で「問題」や「トラブル」を意味する一般的な単語です。日常会話で頻繁に使われ、様々な状況における困難や面倒事を表すのに役立ちます。

example_sentences.sentence: A falta de planejamento causou muita encrenca no projeto.
example_sentences.translation: The lack of planning caused a lot of trouble in the project.

example_sentences.sentence: Ele se meteu numa encrenca por causa de dívidas.
example_sentences.translation: He got into trouble because of debts.

example_sentences.sentence: Não quero arrumar encrenca com ninguém.
example_sentences.translation: I don't want to cause trouble with anyone.
